lines.text:
[singing]
From the halls of Montezuma to the shores of Tripoli / Hear those bells of freedom ringing - Oh, no, it's just the phone for me.
[answers telephone]
Hello? Yes, this is Daffy Duck. You say you have a letter for me from the President? You'll bring it right over? Oh, you're the little man from the draft board. Gee, thanks.
[resumes singing]
Oh, the little man from the draft board is coming to see me. Oh, the... d-d-d-d-d - The man from the draft board? Oh ho-ho! Yipe!
I guess he's gone now.
Well, now, I wouldn't say that.
lines.character: The Little Man from the Draft Board

lines.text: Good heavens. That was quite an explosion. Are you hurt, son?
lines.character: The Little Man from the Draft Board

lines.text: Oh, I'm a little shaken up, but you should've seen what happened to that dope from the draft board. He was blown to smithereens, see? Smithereens!
Well, now, I...
lines.character: The Little Man from the Draft Board

lines.text: No! No! You wouldn't say that! It's you! It's you!
So long, Dracula! Hoo-hoo, hoo! You dope!

[has blown himself to Hell]
Say, what's cooking? Where am I? Say, this place looks like... Hey, it is... I am in...! Oh well. Anyway, I sure put it over on that dope from the draft board.

[takes off demon costume]
Well, now, I wouldn't say that.
lines.character: The Little Man from the Draft Board

lines.text: No! No! No! Don't! Don't say...
[runs away while the little man follows him]
What's all the hub-bub, bub?
lines.character: The Little Man from the Draft Board

lines.text:
[reading newspaper]
"U.S. Army announces a smashing frontal attack on enemy rear."
[to camera]
A smashing frontal attack on enemy rear? HOORAY!
